This step makes a RESTful call into z/OSMF to obtain a port that can be used by the provisioned region to listen for inbound Web user interface requests. The port is obtained from a pool of available ports.

If the step fails, the response from the RESTful call into z/OSMF contains information about the failure. To view the response data, locate the failing workflow in z/OSMF, then expand the step titled Allocating dynamic ports and select the failed step. Next, select the Status tab to show the JSON request and response information. Refer to the Response tab to understand why the step failed.

To view the Status tab, your userid must be the step owner. If you are a domain administrator, you can set your userid to be the step owner by performing the following actions. Find the failing workflow in the Workflows table and modify the workflow owner to be your userid, by ticking the checkbox next to the workflow, then selecting Actions -> Modify and specifying your userid as the owner. To take ownership of the workflow step, click on the name of the workflow to view its steps, then tick the checkbox next to the failing workflow step in the Workflow Steps table. Select Actions -> Assignment and Ownership -> Take Ownership. You should then be able to view the Status of the failing step.

Alternatively, refer to the z/OSMF log for information about the failure. The default log location is /var/zosmf/data/logs/IZUG0.log
